playn.core

Interface GroupLayer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Layer
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    GroupLayer.Clipped
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GroupLayerCanvas, GroupLayerCanvas.Clipped, GroupLayerGL, GroupLayerGL.Clipped

    public interface GroupLayer
extends Layer
    GroupLayer creates a Layer hierarchy by maintaining an ordered group of child Layers.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  GroupLayer.Clipped
      A clipped group layer.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface playn.core.Layer

        Layer.HasSize, Layer.HitTester, Layer.Util

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods

      Adds a layer to the bottom of the group.

      Adds the supplied layer to this group layer, adjusting its translation (relative to this group layer) to the supplied values.

      Deprecated.

      • Methods inherited from interface playn.core.Layer

        addListener, addListener, addListener, alpha, depth, destroy, destroyed, hitTest, hitTestDefault, interactive, originX, originY, parent, rotation, scaleX, scaleY, setAlpha, setDepth, setHitTester, setInteractive, setOrigin, setRotation, setScale, setScale, setScaleX, setScaleY, setShader, setTint, setTranslation, setTx, setTy, setVisible, tint, transform, tx, ty, visible

    • Method Detail

      • get

        Layer get(int index)
        Returns the layer at the specified index.

        Layers are ordered in terms of their depth and will be returned in this order, with 0 being the layer on bottom.

      • add

        void add(Layer layer)
        Adds a layer to the bottom of the group.

        Because the Layer hierarchy is a tree, if the Layer is already a child of another GroupLayer, it will be removed before being added to this GroupLayer.

      • addAt

        void addAt(Layer layer,
           float tx,
           float ty)
        Adds the supplied layer to this group layer, adjusting its translation (relative to this group layer) to the supplied values. This is equivalent to: 
        
 layer.setTranslation(tx, ty);
 group.add(layer);
        but is such a common operation that this helper method is provided.

      • remove

        void remove(Layer layer)
        Removes a layer from the group.

      • removeAll

        void removeAll()
        Removes all child layers from this group.

      • destroyAll

        void destroyAll()
        Removes and destroys all child layers from this group.

      • size

        int size()
        Returns the number of layers in this group.

      • clear

        @Deprecated
void clear()
        Deprecated. Use removeAll().
